sen.j: 1885年7月16日、旅館「白木屋」がこの日開業した日本鉄道宇都宮駅で握り飯2個とたくあんを竹の皮に包んだものを発売したのが最初とする説が広く流通している（→駅弁記念日と駅弁の日）。
sen.e: The theory is widely believed that 'Shirokiya Inn' sold the first Ekiben--two rice balls and a few slices of pickled daikon radish wrapped by a sheet of bamboo bark-- at the newly opened Utsunomiya Station of Nippon Railway on July 16, 1885 (refer to the section of "The memorial day of Ekiben" and "The day of Ekiben").

sen.e: However, the sales slumped after the company was forced to give up not only producing box lunch containing beef products but also importing beef due to BSE affair, with the result that the company ended the sale after having sold out all stocked 'O-bento' by October, 2007.

sen.j: 狭義の意味では、「駅弁」とは、社団法人日本鉄道構内営業中央会（以下「中央会」と略す）に加盟している業者が調製し、駅構内で販売しており、なおかつ米飯が入っている弁当のみを指すこともある。
sen.e: In the narrow sense, 'Ekiben' only indicates a box lunch satisfying all conditions that "it contains cooked rice," "it was produced by a company joining The Central Committee of the Japanese Association of Railroad Station Concessionaires (hereafter, 'Center Committee'), " and "it is sold within the station precincts."

In the narrow sense, 'Ekiben' only indicates a box lunch satisfying the following conditions: "it contains cooked rice," "it was produced by a company joining the Central Committee of the Japanese Association of Railroad Station Concessionaires (hereafter, 'Center Committee'), " and "it is sold within station precincts."
sen.cmt: 冠詞条件のところをカンマ変更して見やすくしました。
sen.e: In the narrow sense, 'Ekiben' only indicates a box lunch satisfying the following conditions: "it contains cooked rice," "it was produced by a company joining the Central Committee of the Japanese Association of Railroad Station Concessionaires (hereafter, 'Center Committee'), " and "it is sold within station precincts."

sen.j: 日本国有鉄道（国鉄）時代には、白飯と焼き魚・肉料理・フライ・卵焼き・蒲鉾などの一般的な惣菜を使用した、いわゆる幕の内弁当の系列のものを普通弁当と称し、それ以外の弁当を特殊弁当と称している。
sen.e: In the period that Japan's railway system was managed by Japan National Railways (JNR), 'Ekiben' containing typical side dishes such as cooked rice, a broiled fish, meat dishes, deep-fried foods, a Japanese style omelet and kamaboko (steamed fish paste), namely a box lunch similar to Makunouchi-bento (box lunch including cooked rice and side dishes), was called "a normal box lunch," while other types of 'Ekiben' was called "a special box lunch."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: When Japan's railway system was managed by Japan National Railways (JNR), 'Ekiben' containing typical side dishes such as cooked rice, a broiled fish, meat dishes, deep-fried foods, a Japanese style omelet and kamaboko (steamed fish paste), namely a box lunch similar to Makunouchi-bento (box lunch including cooked rice and side dishes), was called "a normal box lunch," while other types of 'Ekiben' was called "a special box lunch."

When Japan's railway system was managed by Japan National Railways (JNR), 'Ekiben' containing typical side dishes such as cooked rice, a broiled fish, meat dishes, deep-fried foods, a Japanese style omelet and kamaboko (steamed fish paste), namely a box lunch similar to Makunouchi-bento (box lunch including cooked rice and side dishes), was called "a normal box lunch," while other types of 'Ekiben' was called "a special box lunch."

As shown in 排骨飯 (dish cooked with boned rib of pork is put on rice) with egg dish, box lunch sold in Taiwan generally consists of rice, meat dish and egg dish.

sen.j: ほかには、日本の食文化の影響で、稲荷寿司や海苔巻といった寿司による弁当も販売されている。
sen.e: The box lunch containing sushi like Inari-zushi (stuffed sushi) and Nori-maki (vinegary rice rolled in dried laver) is also sold, because Taiwanese food culture is influenced by the Japanese food culture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The box lunch containing sushi like Inari-zushi (stuffed sushi) and Nori-maki (vinegary rice rolled in dried laver seaweed) is also sold, because Taiwanese food culture is influenced by the Japanese food culture.

The box lunch containing sushi like Inari-zushi (stuffed sushi) and Nori-maki (vinegary rice rolled in dried laver seaweed) is also sold, because Taiwanese food culture is influenced by the Japanese food culture.

sen.j: このような弁当は駅により多少の違いはあるが、どの駅でも大きな差異はなく比較的画一的である。
sen.e: Even if purchasers buy these box lunch at any station, they may enjoy comparatively standardized meal, without finding big differences among them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Purchasers enjoy comparatively standardized box lunches, without finding big differences among stations.
sen.cmt: 前半部分は不要のため削除
sen.e: Purchasers enjoy comparatively standardized box lunches, without finding big differences among stations.

sen.j: 日本の駅弁ほどには多種多様ではない。
sen.e: Therefore, it can be said those lunch box have less variety than Ekiben in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Therefore, it can be said those lunch box have less variety than Ekiben in Japan.
Therefore, it can be said those lunch box have less variety than Ekiben in Japan.

sen.j: 大韓民国でも駅構内や車内販売で、飯にプルコギを主体とする惣菜を合わせた幕の内弁当のような弁当、その他の飯と数種の惣菜による幕の内弁当のような弁当、海苔巻の弁当が販売されている。
sen.e: In Republic of Korea, box lunch similar to Makunouchi-bento containing rice, the main dish Bulgogi (Korean style grilled beef), and other side dishes, Makunouchi-bento-like box lunch containing rice and some side dishes, as well as box lunch of Nori-maki, are sold within the station precincts or on the train.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In Republic of Korea, box lunches similar to Makunouchi-bento containing rice, the main dish Bulgogi (Korean style grilled beef) and other side dishes, Makunouchi-bento-like box lunches containing rice and some side dishes, as well as box lunches of Nori-maki, are sold within station precincts or on the train.

In Republic of Korea, box lunches similar to Makunouchi-bento containing rice, the main dish Bulgogi (Korean style grilled beef) and other side dishes, Makunouchi-bento-like box lunches containing rice and some side dishes, as well as box lunches of Nori-maki, are sold within station precincts or on the train.

sen.j: 台湾のものと比べれば多様性があるが、日本の駅弁ほどの多様性はない。
sen.e: These box lunch are enjoying more variety than those sold in Taiwan, but less than Ekiben in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: These box lunches are enjoying more variety than those sold in Taiwan, but less than Ekiben in Japan.
These box lunches are enjoying more variety than those sold in Taiwan, but less than Ekiben in Japan.

sen.j: 中華人民共和国では食堂車の営業する列車の車内販売で、飯の上に肉料理など惣菜の載った弁当が食堂車で調製され、熱いままの状態で販売される。
sen.e: In the People's Republic of China, passengers can buy a box lunch of rice topped with side dishes like meat dish, which are cooked in the kitchen of dining car and served in hot condition through the service of sales in the train.

In the People's Republic of China, passengers can buy a box lunch of rice topped with side dishes like meat dish, which are cooked in the kitchen of dining cars and served hot through the service of sales in the train.

In the People's Republic of China, passengers can buy a box lunch of rice topped with side dishes like meat dish, which are cooked in the kitchen of dining cars and served hot through the service of sales in the train.

sen.j: 東南アジア・南アジアの鉄道駅構内や車内販売では、タイ王国では飯の上に肉料理と目玉焼きの載ったもの、混ぜご飯などの弁当が小さな散蓮華を付けて販売されている。
sen.e: As for Southeast Asia and South Asia, a box lunch of rice topped with meat dish and a sunny-side up, a box lunch of cooked rice with added ingredients and other types of box lunch are sold by applying a chirirenge (ceramic spoon) within the station precincts or on the train in Kingdom of Thailand.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: As for Southeast Asia and South Asia, a box lunch of rice topped with meat dish and a sunny-side up, a box lunch of cooked rice with added ingredients and other types of box lunch are sold with a chirirenge (ceramic spoon) within station precincts or on the train in Kingdom of Thailand.

As for Southeast Asia and South Asia, a box lunch of rice topped with meat dish and a sunny-side up, a box lunch of cooked rice with added ingredients and other types of box lunch are sold with a chirirenge (ceramic spoon) within station precincts or on the train in Kingdom of Thailand.

sen.j: ベトナムでもちまきなどが販売され、インドでもカレーに飯やナンなどのパン類を合わせた食事セットが鉄道駅で販売される。
sen.e: In Vietnam, chimaki (a rice dumpling wrapped in bamboo leaves) are sold, and in India, a set of meal consists of curry and rice or bread like nan bread are sold at railway station.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In Vietnam, chimaki (a rice dumpling wrapped in bamboo leaves) are sold, and in India, a set of meal consists of curry and rice or bread like nan bread are sold at railway stations.
In Vietnam, chimaki (a rice dumpling wrapped in bamboo leaves) are sold, and in India, a set of meal consists of curry and rice or bread like nan bread are sold at railway stations.

sen.j: しかしいずれの国でも日本のようにこれらを「駅弁」として特別視する文化・意識は特にないようである。
sen.e: However, unlike 'Ekiben' in Japan, none of them have a culture or sense to pay special attention to these box lunch.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, unlike 'Ekiben' in Japan, none of them have a culture or sense to pay special attention to these box lunch.
However, unlike 'Ekiben' in Japan, none of them have a culture or sense to pay special attention to these box lunch.

sen.j: ヨーロッパではイタリア北部・中部の各地で、肉料理に野菜、パスタ、パンかサンドウィッチ、小瓶のワインを合わせた食事セットが販売される鉄道駅がある。
sen.e: In Europe, some railway stations in northern and middle Italy sell a set of meal consists of meat dish, vegetable, pasta, bread or sandwich, and a small bottle of wine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In Europe, some railway stations in northern and middle Italy sell a set of meal consists of meat dish, vegetable, pasta, bread or sandwich, and a small bottle of wine.
In Europe, some railway stations in northern and middle Italy sell a set of meal consists of meat dish, vegetable, pasta, bread or sandwich, and a small bottle of wine.

sen.j: 食事セットはどの駅でも大きな差異はない。
sen.e: There are little difference in quality and quantity of the meal among stations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: There are little difference in quality and quantity of the meal among stations.
There are little difference in quality and quantity of the meal among stations.

sen.j: 販売される駅も日本の駅弁販売駅ほど多くはない。
sen.e: However, the number of stations selling such meal is less than that selling Ekiben in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, the number of stations selling such a meal is less than that selling Ekiben in Japan.
However, the number of stations selling such a meal is less than that selling Ekiben in Japan.

sen.j: そもそも、ヨーロッパの路線は乗車時間が長く食事が2回以上必要な場合が多かった。
sen.e: In railway routes connecting European cities, many passengers needed meal twice or more, because they used to stay on a train for long.
In railway routes connecting European cities, many passengers needed a meal twice or more, because they used to stay on a train for a long time.
sen.cmt: 冠詞for long→for a long time
sen.e: In railway routes connecting European cities, many passengers needed a meal twice or more, because they used to stay on a train for a long time.

sen.j: そのため、調理された食料を持ち込んでも2度目の食事には食べられない。
sen.e: Therefore, even if they carried cooked meal with them on the train, those meals were insufficient in quantity or dangerous in terms of food safety to eat after several hours had passed.
Therefore, even if they carried cooked meals with them on the train, those meals could not be eaten for the second meal.
sen.cmt: 複数形意訳されていたので原文に近い形に変更
sen.e: Therefore, even if they carried cooked meals with them on the train, those meals could not be eaten for the second meal.

sen.j: その上、大抵の長距離路線では日本よりはメニューが豊かで味がいい料理が出るビュフェが連結されている。
sen.e: Moreover, a buffet car was usually attached to such a train traveling long distance, boasting various menu and delicious dishes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Moreover, a buffet car was usually attached to such a train traveling long distance, boasting various menus and delicious dishes.
Moreover, a buffet car was usually attached to such a train traveling long distance, boasting various menus and delicious dishes.

sen.j: また軽食を途中駅で買ったり食べたり出来る時間が有る。
sen.e: Passengers could also afford to buy or eat snacks at station during a stop.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Passengers had time to buy or eat snacks at a station during a stop.
Passengers had time to buy or eat snacks at a station during a stop.

sen.j: そのため日本のように駅弁の概念が発達しなかった、と言われる。
sen.e: Therefore, unlike in Japan, it is believed that the concept of Ekiben was not fostered in Europe.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Therefore, unlike in Japan, it is believed that the concept of Ekiben was not fostered in Europe.
Therefore, unlike in Japan, it is believed that the concept of Ekiben was not fostered in Europe.

sen.j: 駅構内等で販売され販売駅等に限定とされる弁当を、「駅弁」と定義する文化・意識は、ほとんど日本固有のものである。
sen.e: The culture and sense defining the box lunch sold within the station precincts, etc. and limited to the station as 'Ekiben' is peculiar to Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The culture and sense defining the box lunch sold within station precincts, etc. and limited to the station as 'Ekiben' is peculiar to Japan.
The culture and sense defining the box lunch sold within station precincts, etc. and limited to the station as 'Ekiben' is peculiar to Japan.

sen.j: 台湾と韓国には多少そのような文化・意識があるとはいえ、日本ほどには確立されていない。
sen.e: Although culture and sense similar to Japan are also growing in Taiwan and South Korea, it is difficult to say that such culture and sense have taken root as much as those in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Although there are cultures and senses similar to Japan in Taiwan and South Korea, they have not taken root as much as those in Japan.
Although there are cultures and senses similar to Japan in Taiwan and South Korea, they have not taken root as much as those in Japan.
